entry.title: Pay-to-Open and UX improvements
entry.summary: In an email exchange, two individuals are discussing the optimization of a new opcode for Bitcoin. One individual suggests using a script-path spend with specific scripts, while the other suggests using `OP_CHECKSPLITSIG` instead. They discuss the use of a constant `R` and whether it is more likely to be fixed than a constant `s`. The discussion also touches on the potential usefulness of the proposed opcode and the possibility of finney attacks ruining all potential use-cases.
